---
title: "document-bulk-signer-response.ts"
---

## High-level description
This code defines schemas and types for the response of a document bulk signer Lambda function. It uses the Zod library for schema validation and extends an existing document reference schema with a URL field.

## Symbols

### `urlSchema`
#### Description
Defines a schema for an object containing a URL string.

#### Internal Logic
Uses Zod to create an object schema with a single `url` property of type string.

### `documentBulkSignerLambdaResponseSchema`
#### Description
Combines the `documentReferenceSchema` with the `urlSchema` to create a schema for the Lambda response.

#### Internal Logic
Uses Zod's `and` method to merge the `documentReferenceSchema` (imported from an external module) with the `urlSchema`.

### `DocumentBulkSignerLambdaResponse`
#### Description
A type definition inferred from the `documentBulkSignerLambdaResponseSchema`.

#### Internal Logic
Uses Zod's `infer` utility to create a TypeScript type based on the schema.

### `documentBulkSignerLambdaResponseArraySchema`
#### Description
Defines a schema for an array of `documentBulkSignerLambdaResponseSchema` objects.

#### Internal Logic
Uses Zod's `array` method to create an array schema of `documentBulkSignerLambdaResponseSchema` elements.

## Dependencies
| Dependency | Purpose |
|:-----------|:--------|
| zod | Used for schema definition and validation |
| @metriport/api-sdk/medical/models/document | Imports the `documentReferenceSchema` |

## References
This code is referenced in other parts of the codebase:

1. In `packages/core/src/external/aws/document-signing/bulk-sign.ts`, the `DocumentBulkSignerLambdaResponse` type is used in the `BulkDownloadWebhookParams` interface.

2. In `packages/api/src/routes/medical/internal-docs.ts`, the `documentBulkSignerLambdaResponseArraySchema` is used to parse the request body in the `/triggerBulkDownloadWebhook` endpoint.

These references indicate that this code is part of a larger system for handling document signing and bulk downloads, likely in a medical or healthcare context.
